medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms developed approximately 2 weeks before admission, starting with intermittent fevers reaching up to 37.7°C. One day before admission, pain in the left flank and lower quadrant appeared, accompanied by foul-smelling urine. The night before admission, the temperature rose to 39.1°C, associated with nausea and pain in the chest, both legs, and abdomen radiating to the back and flanks. Pain rated 8 out of 10.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Cerebral palsy with spastic quadriplegia, obesity, iron-deficiency anemia, polycystic ovary syndrome with irregular menses, recurrent urinary tract infections, and nephrolithiasis. A ureteral stent was placed temporarily 10 years earlier due to obstructing stone in the left ureter.
medical_history.family_history: Father and paternal grandfather had diabetes mellitus; father had reactive arthritis; one grandfather had relapsing polychondritis; two grandparents had coronary artery disease.
medical_history.social_history: Drinks alcohol socially, does not smoke or use illicit drugs, lives with parents and a sibling in an urban area, recently broke up with her boyfriend, uses a wheelchair, follows a low-oxalate diet.
